programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?

programme.title: Lone Star Law

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff and the team are on a time limit to treat an English bulldog who swallowed a rock. Hector gets a workout from some puppies in need

programme.desc: The expedition takes an intriguing turn when Bryce comes across a photo of a human-like hand with claws. Ronny and Mireya use new tech to help narrow the search

programme.desc: Disaster strikes as Atz Lee and Jane hunt for black bears, while Atz Sr, Bonnie and Shane try to defend the head of the bay against grizzlies

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People

programme.title: Expedition Bigfoot
programme.desc: Russell finds a structure he believes is a Bigfoot nest. Meanwhile, new team member Ronny joins Mireya in a race to the nest to collect DNA samples

programme.title: Treehouse Masters

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: When Barney, a dog with an embedded collar, is spotted in the Houston countryside Investigator Kristi Franks is called into action and a desperate chase ensues

programme.title: Wildlife on One
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the phenomenal construction abilities of the beaver, which combines the skills of a lumberjack, carpenter and hydro-engineer. He compares the industrious creature to humans to find out who deserves the title of master builder

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don heads to India, where he takes in some of the most masterful examples of horticultural and architectural extravagance in the world - including the gardens of the Taj Mahal. Along the way, the green-fingered presenter investigates the majestic tomb gardens of the Mughal emperors, and a unique rock sculpture garden created from discarded objects and rubbish

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: Katie Derham presents from the Royal Albert Hall as Riccardo Minasi conducts the Hamburg-based Ensemble Resonanz and soloists Clara-Jumi Kang and Timothy Ridout in an all-Mozart celebration, including music from The Marriage of Figaro and Don Giovanni

programme.title: Life of a Mountain: A Year on Helvellyn
programme.desc: Documentary observing 12 months on the mountain in the Lake District, featuring insights from those that live by, care for and visit the area. The films contributors create a picture of Helvellyn that combines nature, adventure sports, art, survival and history. Featuring an RAF low-level fighter plane flight through the much-loved landscape

programme.title: Britains Lost Waterlands: Escape to Swallows and Amazons Country
programme.desc: Presenters Dick Strawbridge and Professor Alice Roberts explore the British landscapes that inspired childrens author Arthur Ransome to write his famous series Swallows and Amazons. Strawbridge uses vintage boats to investigate three iconic waterlands - the Lake District, the Norfolk broads, and the Suffolk coastline - while Roberts takes a look at the shore lines

programme.title: Genius of the Ancient World
programme.desc: Bettany Hughes turns her attention to Socrates, detailing how the Athenian philosopher secured a reputation as an influential maverick. She also highlights how his contributions as one of the founders of Western philosophy did not please his detractors, as his outspoken defence of his beliefs ultimately led to his execution

programme.title: The Story of Welsh Art
programme.desc: Huw Stephens explores how, from the 18th-century, the dramatic landscape of Wales captivated artists like Richard Wilson and JMW Turner, who painted it in ways that changed the course of art history. Huw also discovers the work of Penry Williams, a Merthyr Tydfil artist who was commissioned to paint his home towns vast Cyfarthfa ironworks

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don heads to India, where he takes in some of the most masterful examples of horticultural and architectural extravagance in the world - including the gardens of the Taj Mahal. Along the way, the green-fingered presenter investigates the majestic tomb gardens of the Mughal emperors, and a unique rock sculpture garden created from discarded objects and rubbish

programme.title: Earths Natural Wonders
programme.desc: The first of three programmes exploring the most inhospitable places on the planet and the people who live there, including a team of Sherpa roping a route on Mount Everests notorious Khumbu Icefall and, on the slopes of Mount Kilimanjaro, farmers fight pitched battles to save their crops from marauding elephants. In the Amazon rainforest, two boys undergo a rite of passage involving hundreds of ants with the most painful stings on Earth, and conservationists in the Grand Canyon try to ensure the survival of one of Americas few surviving condor chicks

programme.title: Britains Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc: Bendor Grosvenor and Emma Dabiri travel to Georgian mansion of Tatton Park in Cheshire, where Bendor has spotted a mysterious portrait of a 16th-century physician in its collection

programme.title: Call My Bluff
programme.desc: Robert Robinson oversees another duel of words and wit as Patrick Campbell, Hannah Gordon and Charles Gray compete against Frank Muir, Angela Rippon and Tim Rice. First broadcast in 1976

programme.title: Face the Music
programme.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against panellists Valerie Pitts, David Attenborough and Tony Lewis. With guest musician Steuart Bedford. First broadcast in 1976

programme.title: Anthony Wall Remembers - Arena
programme.desc: When young music journalist and radio trainee Anthony Wall joined the BBC Arena team in 1978 he had no idea what lasting impact this documentary arts strand would have on his life and career. Under the guidance of then series editor Alan Yentob, and working alongside director Nigel Finch, films such as My Way, Desert Island Discs and The Private Life of the Ford Cortina would breathe new life into arts programming in the UK. As Arena celebrates its 50th anniversary, Anthony looks back fondly on his time as producer, director and longest-running series editor, celebrating the films and people that made it ground-breaking, unmissable and unforgettable TV

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: A 1979 edition of the arts documentary exploring the appeal and power of Paul Ankas song My Way, most famously associated with Frank Sinatra, but which has also been recorded by such diverse artists as Elvis Presley, Shirley Bassey and Sid Vicious. With contributions from Anka himself, George Brown, Dorothy Squires and Barry John

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: A 2012 profile of the writer, from impoverished schoolmaster whose first novel Lord of the Flies was published when he was 43, through to his winning the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1983, to his death 10 years later. The film has unprecedented access to his unpublished diaries, in which he recorded his dreams - revealing his private obsessions and insecurities. The authors children, Judy and David, speak frankly about their fathers demons, while other contributors include playwright Nigel Williams and author Stephen King. Benedict Cumberbatch reads extracts from Goldings work

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: A 1997 edition of the arts documentary exploring the cultural significance of the fruit, including musician John Cale telling the story behind Andy Warhols cover for the Velvet Undergrounds debut allbum. Auberon Waugh and John Walters recall their first encounters with bananas after the war and former footballer Brendan Batson considers how they became a symbol of racism when hurled at black players from the terraces

programme.title: Britains Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc: Bendor Grosvenor and Emma Dabiri travel to Georgian mansion of Tatton Park in Cheshire, where Bendor has spotted a mysterious portrait of a 16th-century physician in its collection

programme.title: Face the Music
programme.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against panellists Valerie Pitts, David Attenborough and Tony Lewis. With guest musician Steuart Bedford. First broadcast in 1976

programme.title: Earths Natural Wonders
programme.desc: The first of three programmes exploring the most inhospitable places on the planet and the people who live there, including a team of Sherpa roping a route on Mount Everests notorious Khumbu Icefall and, on the slopes of Mount Kilimanjaro, farmers fight pitched battles to save their crops from marauding elephants. In the Amazon rainforest, two boys undergo a rite of passage involving hundreds of ants with the most painful stings on Earth, and conservationists in the Grand Canyon try to ensure the survival of one of Americas few surviving condor chicks

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Liverpool v Everton at Anfield and Manchester United v Chelsea at Old Trafford. Reigning champions Liverpool will have been expecting three points and bragging rights against their Merseyside neighbours. The Blues and Red Devils were both looking to claim victory after they had to share the spoils in a 1-1 draw at the Theatre of Dreams last term. Plus, Brighton and Hove Albion v Tottenham Hotspur, Burnley v Nottingham Forest, West Ham United v Crystal Palace, Wolverhampton Wanderers v Leeds United and Fulham v Brentford

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: Sunday Politics Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers presents the political developments of the week, with policy-makers questioned on the key issues

programme.title: Prayer and Reflection
programme.sub-title: Prayer and Reflection from Islandmagee Presbyterian Church, Northern Ireland
programme.desc: The Rev Mark Russell leads a service at Islandmagee Presbyterian Church in Co Antrim on the theme of unity, with readings from Corinthians and music by the gathered congregations from Islandmagee, Ballycarry and Whitehead. With a sermon by the churchs Rev Peter Bovill, and prayers led by Claire Sego of Whitehead Presbyterian Church

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye presents coverage of the second session on the ninth and final day of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo. Relay events form a key part of the final days schedules, with the mens and womens 4x400m races taking place at 12.25 and 12.40 respectively, the womens 4x100m at 1.10 and the mens equivalent at 1.20. There should also be British interest in the womens 800m final at 11.35, with Olympic champion Keely Hodgkinson expected to be involved. Plus, finals in the womens high jump from 11.30, mens 5,000m at 11.50, discus from 12.00 and 1500m at 12.55, and the concluding event of the decathlon, the 1500m, at 12.55. With analysis from Jessica Ennis-Hill and Jenny Meadows, and commentary by Steve Cram, Steve Backley, Andrew Cotter, Colin Jackson, Paula Radcliffe and Stef Reid

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Claire McCollum helps bring in the harvest on a farm in Devon, where faith and farming go back five generations, and introduces favourite harvest hymns. Plus, a Christian residential community in Rutland for people with learning disabilities where growing and harvesting their own produce helps them flourish. Hymns include We Plough the Fields and Scatter, To God be the Glory and For the Beauty of the Earth

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Manchester United v Arsenal (Kick-off 2.50pm). All the action from the match at Leigh Sports Village. These teams finished third and second respectively last season and their squads contain several of the stars of Englands Euro 2025 triumph, including United midfielder Ella Toone and Arsenals attacking trio of Alessia Russo, Beth Mead and Chloe Kelly

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A couple and their three children are looking for a change of lifestyle for the whole family, and Nicki Chapman is in Norfolk to help them find it. Nicki also meets some of the residents of Hemsby, whose homes are at risk from coastal erosion, to learn how the whole village is pulling together to help save them

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Adam Henson explore the Solway Coast, where ancient traditions and fragile wildlife are being carefully nurtured by those who call the borderland home. Joe joins some of the last remaining Haaf netters in the tidal waters of the Solway Firth and Adam puts his sheepdog Gwen to work on his farm in the Cotswolds ahead of the biggest event in the trialling calendar

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents from Finchley, North London where Joanna Hardy strikes gold with an unusual Italian bracelet and Alexandra Gill finds a rare painting of Hamlets Ophelia. Claire Tole-Moir leafs through a guest book from the Live Aid after party and Fuchsia Voremberg examines an illustrated Ships Log

programme.title: Freddie Flintoffs Field of Dreams
programme.sub-title: Freddie Flintoffs Field of Dreams: Ultimate Test
programme.desc: When numbers dwindle in Manchester, Presley and the boys are forced to go on a recruitment drive in order to save their team, but Freddie faces a losing battle fundraising the money to restore the club to its former glory. In Blackpool, after the team building day, the girls team play their first match against a prestigious boarding school. Freddie questions the teams commitment when only a few boys turn up to training in Liverpool

programme.title: King and Conqueror
programme.desc: Ambition drives William and Harold to each seek costly alliances, against the advice of their womenfolk, to enhance their chances of winning the crown

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Arsenal v Manchester City at Emirates Stadium. Arsenal claimed a stunning 5-1 win in last seasons corresponding fixture, with five different players finding the net for the Gunners, but Pep Guardiolas men will have been determined to give a better account of themselves this time around. Plus, Bournemouth v Newcastle United and Sunderland v Aston Villa

programme.title: The Womens Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest matches in the Super League including Chelsea v Leicester City, Manchester United v Arsenal and Tottenham Hotspur v Manchester City

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Comedy, written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan, following one mans quest for attention from anyone wholl give it to him. After splitting up with Guy, Jamma is now between jobs and sleeping on Winnies sofa. However, when he unexpectedly sees Guy for the first time in six months at Isaacs pop-up art exhibition, the spark between the exes is undeniable. To Jamma and Guys surprise a handsome stranger takes a special interest in their relationship status. With Russell Tovey

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Guys double-booked himself, so asks Jamma to house-sit and let a builder in. Jamma finds Guys manuscript about exes, but on discovering hes not included is sent into a spiral. Isaac comes over to calm Jamma down, but the pair discover Saif pampering himself in the house. Farida arrives with divorce papers and a new showbiz career to show off about. Sitcom, written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan and Russell Tovey

programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Louise Minchin present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: SAS: Catching the Criminals
programme.desc: Billy Billingham discovers how police forces are using military tactics. The first episode focuses on the hunt for a drug kingpin operating in Greater Manchester

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the stories of three renovation projects on properties in Wednesbury in the West Midlands, Dunvant in Swansea and Norwich

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from Stoneleigh antiques fair in Warwickshire where Caroline Hawley and Tim Weeks help two teams search for collectibles to take to auction. Tara and Owain on the red team search for papery things and come across a cranberry glass vase while Sophie and Jenny on the blue team are drawn to an art deco silver bar brooch

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: Mark Wright, Maxine Dwyer and Asher Edwards, along with a team of helpers, help Jess make space in her home for her brother and her boyfriend to move in. Maxine gets to work on the wardrobe while Asher builds a bespoke desk and vinyl storage. The team transform the spare room into an office and reimagines the lean-to as a living space for Jesss brother Stuart

programme.title: Robson Greens Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Robson, his nephew Daymon, brother David and uncle Matheson clamber into a camper van and head south to County Durham. The first stop sees them don wetsuits to have a go at white water tubing in an extremely cold river

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah is house-hunting in Somerset with a couple from New York, offering up a striking long house and a converted water mill

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: James Broad and Lauren Wood help Sue sell some of her cherished collections to help fund a special holiday with her daughters and grandchildren. Lauren hopes to make a sensitive repair to a pair of masks made by Asante tribespeople in Ghana and restores a Victorian tea caddy thats been turned into a money box. James uncovers an impressive array of silverware and an RAF-embossed powder compact that Sues dad gifted to her mum during the war

programme.title: The Answer Run
programme.desc: Jason Manford hosts the fast-paced quiz show in which three couples face a series of 50/50 questions that hurtle down the Answer Run towards them

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Angela Rippon

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The Slaters are still in shock from last nights ordeal - but they remain suspicious when Zoe continues to evade the truth. Sharon arrives back in Walford and is surprised to see Zoe, Cindy causes tension between Lauren and Peter and an accident at the Albert leads to Mos firing

programme.title: Restoration Rescue
programme.desc: Architect Patrick Bradley heads to Ballymena where he meets retired couple Stephen and Marie who are on a mission to restore a row of derelict cottages into their new family home. The project soon faces a a major hurdle, the original thatched roof from the 1800s is beyond repair and most of the structure is no longer viable

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: As the UK and others prepare to officially recognise a Palestinian state at the United Nations, Panorama and BBC Eye investigate the desperate shortages of food in Gaza and the allegations of war crimes. With Israel on the verge of expanding its military campaign in the Gaza Strip and blaming Hamas for the shortages of food there, Jeremy Bowen asks what all this means for the million or so Palestinians who now face being displaced from their homes in Gaza City, and for those facing the prospect of fleeing again

programme.title: The Guest
programme.desc: Ria finds herself a fugitive on the run. She must stay one step ahead of the police - and Fran - long enough to repair old relationships and discover the evidence that will clear her

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Trying
programme.desc: Nikki and Jason attend an adoption support picnic and are alarmed at the different achievements of members of the group. Developing an inferiority complex, they come to realise that these are not the people they need to impress.

programme.title: Trying
programme.desc: Hung over after a night out, Nikki and Jason are horrified to realise they have forgotten that Penny from the adoption agency is arriving for a home visit and pull out all the stops to impress her

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Roy Wood Jr hosts this edition from November 2024 in which broadcaster Richard Osman and comedian Roisin Conaty join Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the US election results

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The film show may be over but the raw emotions seem likely to continue long after. The couples split into two groups and head off for days out on separate islands - unaware that castaways, some of whom are all too familiar, plan to gatecrash their parties. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The events of castaway day cause a tidal wave across Honeymoon Island. A crate washes up to give the honeymooners some much-needed support from home, before one husband is left with a shocking decision to make. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Athletics: World Championships Highlights
programme.desc: Sarah Mulkerrins presents action from the ninth and final day of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo. Great Britains Olympic champion Keely Hodgkinson hoped to be in contention in the 800m final, and her compatriot Josh Kerr was the reigning title-holder in the mens 1500m. Medals were also awarded in the mens and womens 4x100m and 4x400m relays

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zoe is still shaken by the shooting, but the police insist it wasnt a targeted attack. The Slaters welcome her home but she finds it too overwhelming and rushes out. Tensions rise between Okie and Harry, and Georges suspicions are raised. Kim considers driving again, Julie reveals shes got a new job at Walford High and Alfie offers Zack the role of chef at the Vic

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zoes fears continue to grow, despite Kat and Anthonys best efforts to reassure her. Worried shes putting everyone in danger, Zoe packs her belongings - but Stacey pleads with her to stay. Ravi is set on putting George out of action, so Harry enlists Kojos help to convince him to take Phils offer of a boxing tour. Ross takes on a second job, leaving Vicki to take on more responsibilities with Joel

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey and Zoe stake out Gregs place. Vicki is furious to learn Joel has played truant from school to attend the podcast recording event, and she turns to Julie for help with his behaviour. Lauren feels guilty when Louies present doesnt arrive in time for his birthday. Cindy suggests Peter should move in to help with the children

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Jack is set on revealing the truth about Zoes shooting, so Denise turns to Ravi for help. Julie attempts to talk to Joel about his misogynistic beliefs - but it may not be enough

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The film show may be over but the raw emotions seem likely to continue long after. The couples split into two groups and head off for days out on separate islands - unaware that castaways, some of whom are all too familiar, plan to gatecrash their parties. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The events of castaway day cause a tidal wave across Honeymoon Island. A crate washes up to give the honeymooners some much-needed support from home, before one husband is left with a shocking decision to make. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The recent flare-up causes suspicion and speculation among the remaining honeymooners - and even some of the strongest couples start to feel the strain of stranded life. At the Couples Cove Masquerade Ball, the arrival of an unexpected guest sends shockwaves through the group. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: Ibiza: Secrets of the Party Island
programme.desc: Zara McDermott delves into the dark economy that keeps the drugs flowing in Ibiza, meeting with the drug supplier who never deals on the streets but feeds a seemingly never-ending supply of Class A drugs to demanding clientele all over the island. She also speaks to the police officers on the front line who are trying to cope with the excessive drug use, often allowing users with small supplies to walk away in order to target the dealers in the act of selling. Officers explain how social media has made their jobs much more difficult and Zara follows as they raid a luxury car rental company next to the main airport

programme.title: Ibiza: Secrets of the Party Island
programme.desc: Zara McDermott meets Spains top lawyer when it comes to defending drug traffickers, Ricardo Alvarez-Ossorio, and joins the Spanish Civil Guard as they tackle organised crime and drug trafficking across the country. While on a night shift with an ambulance crew, Zara speaks to a nurse who explains how Ibiza is the ideal testing ground for new drugs

programme.title: We Built a Zoo
programme.desc: Documentary following 19-year-old TikTok star Kyle Thomas as he attempts to build a zoo for exotic species and separate himself from past controversy with animal rights activists. He enlists the help of farmer and builder Phil Hughes and together the pair plan on turning Phils modest petting farm into a world-class sanctuary for unwanted exotic animals

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Comedy, written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan, following one mans quest for attention from anyone wholl give it to him. After splitting up with Guy, Jamma is now between jobs and sleeping on Winnies sofa. However, when he unexpectedly sees Guy for the first time in six months at Isaacs pop-up art exhibition, the spark between the exes is undeniable. To Jamma and Guys surprise a handsome stranger takes a special interest in their relationship status. With Russell Tovey

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Guys double-booked himself, so asks Jamma to house-sit and let a builder in. Jamma finds Guys manuscript about exes, but on discovering hes not included is sent into a spiral. Isaac comes over to calm Jamma down, but the pair discover Saif pampering himself in the house. Farida arrives with divorce papers and a new showbiz career to show off about. Sitcom, written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan and Russell Tovey

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films
programme.desc: Comedy short film, written by and starring Jack Robertson. An out-of-work actor thinks he has hit rock bottom when he is hired to perform in an off-season panto tour playing to dementia homes - until he is unexpectedly confronted with the reality of life, his future and where it ends

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Charles II bans coffee shops, a sea-sick chicken ruins a Roman sea battle, Rameses II meets peasants on Historical Wife Swap and a stone-age couple buy their first house

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: A Victorian businessman goes undercover in his own factory, there is an argument over who rules medieval England and the Real Tudor Hustle reveals cons by historical criminals

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson spares no expense when he tests the BMW X6. James May joins Margaret Calvert, one of Britains road-sign designers, to test-drive the Vauxhall Insignia VXR, and Richard Hammond tries out a £340,000 Lexus supercar. Blues musician Seasick Steve is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
programme.desc: Journalist Tir Dhondy investigates the disappearance of Sarm Heslop, who went missing from a luxury Caribbean charter yacht in 2021. Tire retraces Sarms last known movements and tracks down two boat captains whose vessels were moored near the yacht she vanished from. Also, she gets to question Ryan Banes, Sarms boyfriend, account of what happened what happened through his lawyer David Cattie

programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
programme.desc: Tir Dhondy meets with island police and is given CCTV footage that has never been released, showing Sarms last known movements with her boyfriend, Ryan Bane

programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
programme.desc: Tir Dhondy searches for the yacht Sarm vanished from, and tracks down Ryan Banes ex-wife, hearing first-hand about her experiences while married to him

programme.title: Before I Go to Sleep
programme.desc: A woman who cannot retain her memories following a traumatic accident is contacted by a mysterious neuropsychologist, who offers to help her recover the truth about her condition. As she tries to piece together the events of her past, she begins to fear neither her husband nor the doctor are who they seem to be. Thriller, starring Nicole Kidman, Colin Firth and Mark Strong

programme.sub-title: Bear Under Lock And Key/Lemming Blues/Snow Lemmings/Augmented Bear/Lemmings Under Pressure/Lemmings in Space
programme.desc: Unwilling to share the food both he and the Lemmings are wild / Grizzy is impressed by the TV show of a magician who transforms a partridge into a bouquet of flowers. / On a very hot day an ice cream commercial awakes the desire of Grizzy. / The Lemmings have discovered a truly wild new game: an augmented reality program on the rangers digital tablet. / The only edible food item left in the rangers cabin is a gorgeous salmon which is stuck inside a block of ice at the back of the freezer compartment. / The Lemmings have unearthed a box filled with birthday fountains of light that spit forth giant bursts of sparks.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: Driving through the Rocky Mountains, the Mystery Inc. gang stumbles upon Weird Al Yankovic, who warns them about a horrible allosaurus

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Race The Beast/Surprise, Its Spring/The Missing Mushlet/The Hero Trap
programme.desc: Mush-Mush and his friends are determined to win the bark sledge race, but their essential fourth team member drops out. / Puff doesn’t like change much. And with spring about to burst forth and all the changes spring brings, he is puffing out nervous fog which is blanketing the whole of Mushton. / So Mushpie can take a break, Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit offer to look after the Mushies, assuring her that everything will be fine. / The Mushlets love Mush-Mush’s heroic stories. But when they demand to see him actually do something heroic, Mush-Mush feels he can’t back out.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Puffs Perfect Picnic/Run, Mushpie, Run/Watch the Storm/Lightning Bark
programme.desc: Because he has won the moss-ball game last year, Puff is in charge of organizing this Summer’s Picnic. Only Puff isn’t comfortable in that role. / Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit notice that Mushpie seems in great shape lately. They want to feel as great as she does and try to discover her secret. / When Chep asks Mush-Mush and Lilit to go storm-watching and they refuse, Lilit feels bad and convinces Mush-Mush to join their friend. / Fung and Miff have come across a rare piece of bark struck by lightning.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Special Delivery/The Perfect Fritter/The Art of Friendship/What a Stinker
programme.desc: Chep knows so many things about nature that Mush-Mush and Lilit are confident he’s not far from being an expert like Mushpot. / Sushi-Mushi tests new compost fritters recipes. When Mush-Mush gets to taste one, he can’t believe it: Sushi-Mushi has cooked the perfect fritter. / When Chanterelle sees how good Lilit is at painting, she offers to help her dig into her talent. / Chep is very excited: tonight, a rare and extremely stinky plant is going to bloom! But he already promised Mush-Mush to play their favourite game.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Mush-Mush The Predictor/Whos Eating Mushton/The Breathtaking Bolly Show/Work Like a Charm/Star Helpers/The Rollinator
programme.desc: Mush-Mush can’t figure out why his sense foot keeps buzzing like crazy… until an earthquake shakes the forest. Mush-Mush is sure he predicted it! / Everyone in Mushton is finding that their precious wooden things are being munched and destroyed by someone or something. / If Mush-Mush had Bolly’s speed, he’d want everyone to see just how awesomely fast he was. / Chep becomes obsessed with learning all about Mushlore – all the funny little traditions and things that Mushables believe in. / Starmush’s back is stuck, and the Mushelder has no choice but to ask for help in Mushton. / Chep is so good at moss-marbles, no one wants to play him anymore! No one except Sumush who reveals himself to be a tough competitor.

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.sub-title: Fake Brothers / Mind in a Whirl / A Sizeable...
programme.desc: ...Problem / Treasure Bear / In the Service of His Majesty / Bear Art / Happy Birthday Lemmings! / Flower Power => Grizzy builds a look-alike robot to keep the Lemmings away. / When she is accidentally hit over the head the she-bear Grizzys in love with thinks shes a Lemming. / A meteorite falls near the log cabin. / Grizzy and the Lemmings find an old treasure card. / When he brandishes an Indian scepter that the Lemmings brought home Grizzy sees the Lemmings bow low before him and behave like servants. / Grizzy tries to impress the she-bear that hes in love with by making a sculpture of her from a piece of wood. / The Lemmings throw a surprise birthday party for one of the clan. / Grizzy wants to impress his beloved she-bear.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables

programme.desc: Mushpie loves to sing. Only problem she is terrible at it! / When Mushpot wishes he could roll back the seasons and relive being a Mushler, our friends get him to hang out doing cool Mushler stuff. / Mush-Mush can’t figure out why his sense foot keeps buzzing like crazy… until an earthquake shakes the forest. Mush-Mush is sure he predicted it! / Everyone in Mushton is finding that their precious wooden things are being munched and destroyed by someone or something. / If Mush-Mush had Bolly’s speed, he’d want everyone to see just how awesomely fast he was

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables

programme.sub-title: Some Like it Cool/Molerskating Mayhem/Duck Moley Duck!/Squirm’s Day Out/Three Gentlemen of Moletown
programme.desc: When Moletown experiences a heatwave, Moley and Dotty hope Mishmosh can invent something to cool things down. / Moley must learn to Molerskate for the Great Mole Roll skating competition and discovers his parents have a hidden talent. / When an egg rolls into Moletown and a duckling hatches, Moley must play momma to the baby duck until they can find its home. / When Moley helps take care of the worms at Dotty’s Adopt a Worm Rescue Center, the Gardener sends Squirm to pose as a homeless worm and help him steal Manny. / When Moley’s Keeper duties are pulling him in too many directions, he gets Manny to create multiple Moleys!

programme.desc: Kika and Dr Amit head to the florist to buy flowers for Amits wife Seema. But theyll need some help from the top secret bumpy bits - the clever dots and lines on the pavement that contain secret messages for visually impaired people - and their guide dogs. Then, Kika guides Amit down the steps to the crossing near the flower shop, which has a tail of bumpy bits all the way across the pavement. But on their way back, Kika finds the crossing blocked by a fallen tree branch. She has to engage her super sit, where she refuses to continue until its safe. programme.desc: Its the Big Beanbag Bash Day and Love Monster is very excited to throw some beanbags and win some games. Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny does better than he does, and Love Monster feels jealous of the attention that she gets. He becomes so frustrated that he kicks a beanbag and it hurtles towards the scoreboard, knocking all the points to the ground, ripping the bunting and giving Delivery Duckling, Elder Chick, Elder Panda and the In-Chicks a fright. The crowd is stunned into silence. Love Monster is horrified at what he has done and immediately says sorry. He explains that he wants everyone to cheer for him like they cheer for Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny. She admits it did feel good and tingly inside when everyone was cheering for her, but she says that everyone has something they are good at and Love Monster is the best beatboxer in Fluffytown. programme.title: Aneeshwar and Lizzie Go Wild
programme.desc: Aneeshwar and Lizzie try to meet sunbirds, but they are hard to spot. Fast-moving and tiny, they fly quickly between the branches. When the pair finally catch sight of them, they manage to see these beautifully coloured birds up close. Next, Aneeshwar and Lizzie encounter a day gecko. These amazing lizards are called day geckos because they are normally seen in the daytime. However, they are starting to come out at night to hunt for insects attracted to streetlamps in cities. Finally, Aneeshwar and Lizzie discover what the wild connection is between these two incredible animals.

programme.title: Whats in Your Bag?

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Kika is a golden Labrador and a guide dog for her owner Dr Amit, who is blind. She is trained to use her supersight to help him do as many things as he can by himself. Together, they make the best team! Kika needs to help Dr Amit catch a train to the city. First, they must walk to the station. Kika knows the way like the back of her paw, but there are some important things they must do along the way. Kika has to help Dr Amit navigate a pelican crossing, using a top secret cone to cross the road safely. Then she must guide him through the station and up the escalator to the platform. There are some hazards to avoid, including a tumbling box full of Kikas favourite snacks - carrots! Then, at the station, their mission is almost derailed by a last-minute platform change. Can Kikas supersight save the day?

programme.sub-title: Take Me Out of the Ball Game

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Rebecca meets her high-school sweetheart and falls for him all over again - but he does not share her fantasies about getting married. Plus, the theft of Sams sports car results in him setting up a victims support group. Bar-room comedy, starring Ted Danson and Kirstie Alley

programme.title: Cheers
programme.sub-title: Bar Wars VI - This Time Its for Real
programme.desc: The traditional battle between the Old Towne Tavern and Cheers takes a new turn when the former comes under new management. programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Norm tricks Cliff into thinking that material he has sent to Johnny Carsons The Tonight Show has been accepted - but the joke soon rebounds on the joker. Starring Ted Danson and George Wendt

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert returns to work after sick leave, but is soon driven to the conclusion that he does not have the nerve to be a policeman any more and decides to pursue a safer career in telemarketing

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert bumps into his ex-wife, and considers rekindling the relationship. Meanwhile, Frank tells Amy the story of how the pair split up in the first place

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: A recurring dream makes Frasier wonder whether he is gay, prompting him to search for an explanation of its meaning - with a little help from Niles. Comedy, with Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin makes friends with reclusive author TH Houghton, to the considerable dismay of Niles and Frasier, who are frustrated that their own attempts to strike up an acquaintance have failed dismally. Comedy, guest starring Robert Prosky (Hill Street Blues), with Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: Sunday Brunch
programme.desc: Alan Davies chats about his memoir, Karen Carney discusses Strictly Come Dancing, comedian Jason Byrne talks touring and actress Niamh McCormack gives the lowdown on new Netflix drama House of Guinness. Plus, music by Good Neighbours. Presented by Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge astonishes Homer and the kids by landing the role of Blanche DuBois in an amateur production of A Streetcar Named Desire - and her performance is boosted by her frustration with Homer. With the guest voice of Jon Lovitz

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer decides to skip church so he can enjoy himself watching TV, making waffles and dancing semi-naked in the guise of Tom Cruise. When he subsequently experiences a vision from God, the lazy father is inspired to start his own religion. Animated comedy, with the voice of Dan Castellaneta

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart misbehaves once too often, prompting Homer and Marge to impose a terrible punishment - banning him from ever going to see the new feature-length Itchy and Scratchy film, and standing firm despite his constant pleas

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This weeks competition kicks off at The Red Lion in Charing Heath, Kent, where the owners treat the other hosts to a masterclass in hospitality at nearby Leeds Castle

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition continues in Battle in East Sussex, at Dean and Beckys Glamp in Style campsite. The hosts have novelty on their side, with their unique accommodation including a converted army truck, a horsebox and a vintage bus but not everyone is keen to embrace the alternative glamping experience. In the afternoon, Becky lets loose with a saucy tale amid the local fauna and flora and at feedback time, cold water leaves the hosts feeling the heat

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Best friends Helen and Phil host the weeks third visit at Tottington Manor in West Sussex. Sam and Claudia are bowled over by the decor, but some guests raise their eyebrows at the high prices. An afternoon at a local rum distillery makes Helen and Phil the toast of the town. The hosts cant stop smiling when they run through their feedback - until some comments right at the end spoil things and give Helen an axe to grind for payment day

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Sam and Claudia host the weeks final visit at their self-catering Lakeview Studios in Dorset. The digs get approving eyes from Claire and Lee, but Dean and Beckys arrival is marked by a problem with their toilet. Ahead of the all-important payment day, battle lines are drawn at a tank museum

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Payment Day promises to be a fiery affair after two sets of BandBers in particular participated in tit-for-tat marking throughout the week. Eventually, the weeks winner is announced

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: Steve Jones presents action from the 17th round of the season, held at the Baku City Circuit. McLarens Oscar Piastri led the standings going into this race, with his teammate and nearest challenger Lando Norris 31 points behind. It was Piastri who took the honours here last year, with Ferraris Charles Leclerc finishing second and George Russell of Mercedes completing the podium. With analysis from Billy Monger and Alice Powell

programme.title: Educating Yorkshire
programme.desc: Year sevens Ismaeel, an enthusiastic ball of energy with his sights set on becoming a student representative for his year, canvasses classmates in the school playground, taking his list to school head Mr Burton who agrees to his real passion project - launching a brand-new chess club. Specialist teacher Mrs Burton is determined to help Lewis in year nine, a star student who was diagnosed with autism at the age of eight, come up with inventive ways to build his confidence - including the new chess club. Assistant Head Mrs Delaney-Hudson is determined not to give up on bright and charming year eight student Jacob who struggles to stay put in lessons

programme.title: The Inheritance
programme.desc: The latest elimination has shifted the balance of power within the estate, exposing the players true intentions as they scramble to secure their place in the game. As alliances and money become more important than ever, whispers, deceit and betrayal ripple through the group

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on programmes including The Inheritance, Long Lost Family, Unknown Number: The High School Catfish, The Yorkshire Vet, Dish It Out and Street Cops: Catching the Yobs. They also appraise ITV News coverage of Peter Mandelsons sacking and street protests in London

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: The Traitors 2023 finalist, Aaron, enters the restaurant looking for love and ends up paired with straight-A student Laura. Krissy returns to the dating scene for the first time after becoming a first-time mum at age 51 and ends up paired with chauffeur-to-the-stars, Rob. British Sign Language user Shaun is hoping his Mr Bean impression will impress party-loving Carly and Retail assistant Neil roller-skates into the restaurant looking for someone who accepts him just the way he is

programme.title: Love Cheats
programme.desc: The story of a man whose partner convinced him she had terminal cancer, and that she had a miscarriage. Devastated by the news, he doubled down on supporting her and goes to work renovating the home of her friend. What he discovers at that house unravels the many layers of deception that she has been weaving

programme.title: The Guilty
programme.desc: Asger, a frustrated and troubled cop, is mired in a mysterious workplace controversy and has been confined to the emergency response help lines while the issue is resolved. He gets a confusing call from a woman named Iben, who appears to be in immediate danger after being abducted by her partner. Asger tries to piece together where she is and how to get help to her. Writer/director Gustav Mollers crime drama, starring Jakob Cedergren. In Danish

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Queens, New York, where he meets a family torn apart by the stress of running failing Greek restaurant Kati Allo. Husband-and-wife owners Manny and Christine are on the brink of divorce, while their daughter Evelyn is caught in the middle and at her wits end

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: American comedian and actress Desiree Burch joins Joe Lycett for some snow-filled shenanigans in the city of Rovaniemi - the official home of Santa Claus - in Finnish Lapland on the edge of the Arctic Circle. The pair try out ice floating by donning rubber suits and climbing into a freezing lake. After they thaw out, they head for a five-course tasting menu inspired by Lappish ingredients including reindeer. On day two, Joe and Desiree experience ice fishing, ride in a traditional Sami reindeer caravan, learn some local handicrafts and look for the Northern lights

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.sub-title: Georges Tree House and Garden Shed Pub
programme.desc: The architect prepares to unveil his multi-functional treehouse in the grounds of Kielder Water and Forest Park in Northumberland, and meets a couple with big plans to build a theatre in a 1970s caravan. Plus, a man who has created a pub in his garden shed, and a 19th-century shepherds hut undergoes restoration using Victorian steam-powered machinery

programme.desc: Part one of two. Marie surprises everyone by arranging a trip to Rome for the whole family, but all Ray can do is complain. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Doris Roberts

programme.desc: Part two of two. As the familys Roman holiday continues, Robert falls in love with sultry local beauty Stefania (Alex Meneses), who works in an ice-cream shop

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond

programme.desc: Daphne is dumped by her boyfriend and causes bemusement in the Crane household by immediately embarking on a new relationship - with a man who looks, dresses, talks and acts exactly like Niles. Comedy, starring Jane Leeves and David Hyde Pierce

programme.desc: Lilith and Frasier are forced to spend time together while trying to convince the headmaster of an exclusive Boston school that their precocious son Frederick would be the ideal pupil. Comedy, guest starring Bebe Neuwirth

Over in France, a couple from Essex snap up a stunning property where they plan to run their events business

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend take on a 1924 Austin 7 Chummy - that doesnt actually belong to its owner. Former painter and decorator Christopher actually bought the Austin back in the early 1960s - it was his first car and as an enthusiastic teenager took on a full rebuild

In central Italy, young couple Lucie and Jerry are more determined than ever to make their earthquake-damaged borgo habitable, while Sarah and Steves Portuguese project proves that you never know what lies ahead, even after a village comes back to life

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first host of the week, Andy, is hoping his guests enjoy the seaside at Sefton Blackpool. But a shocking discovery at breakfast leaves all of the BandBers nonplussed

Meanwhile on the Costa Blanca in the province of Alicante, husband and wife Damon and Sophie Rodriguez are back to meet ex-airforce duo Eileen and Martin, who back in 2018 were looking to retire to the sun

programme.title: Channel 4 News

programme.title: Jamie: Eat Yourself Healthy
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how he incorporates more white fish into his diet, by serving up cod in crispy filo pastry and a sensational tomato orzo. Next, he combines calcium-rich tofu with mushrooms containing vitamin D to deliver a crowd-pleasing stew with dumplings, and cooks up prawn curry using chickpeas and sweet mango. Plus, the latest science about how protein could help keep energy levels stable

programme.title: The Inheritance
programme.desc: As the Deceaseds devious game nears its dramatic conclusion, the players are pushed to their limits and forced to adapt their strategies and sharpen their instincts in order to survive. Every move is under scrutiny, every alliance tested, and with the stakes higher than ever, the fight to secure a place in the finale grows ruthless

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Fifteen-year-old James comes in after being struck in the eye with an arrow during an archery class. Dr Ian, who treats him, shares his neurodiversity experience from childhood and the difficulties he faced growing up. Fifty-year-old joiner Chris has a wound to his head after a work accident, he shares his injuries and treatment with his many social media followers

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Twenty-one-year-old Connor is rushed in after a motorbike accident leaving him with leg and lung injuries. Sixty nine-year-old Rob, who has locked-in-syndrome, is admitted into resus after his breathing tube becomes dislodged leaving him unable to breathe properly. In minor injuries, 58-year-old Lisa receives treatment for an injured wrist

programme.title: Educating Yorkshire
programme.desc: Year sevens Ismaeel, an enthusiastic ball of energy with his sights set on becoming a student representative for his year, canvasses classmates in the school playground, taking his list to school head Mr Burton who agrees to his real passion project - launching a brand-new chess club. programme.title: Taskmaster

Meanwhile, Phil Ellis finds something surprising inside a fake fish and Ania Magliano makes a startling revelation. As ever Little Alex Horne does his level best to maintain a little decorum

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of Mangia Mangia, an Italian restaurant with an identity crisis in Woodland Park, Colorado, where guests have a choice between casual fine-dining service or a pick-up from the drive-through takeaway. Hard-nosed owner Julie finds herself completely at odds with the head chef, forcing her to breaking point

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp are in south-east London with two couples for whom timing is critical. In and around the Isle of Dogs and Greenwich, Lia and Andrew have saved a big deposit and have a sizeable budget of £600,000 to spend. But, after witnessing the crash of 2008, Andrew is nervous of spending his hard-earned money for fear the market will dip. Lucy and Dan live in a BandB and if they dont find somewhere soon their vintage campervan will become their home. Kirstie shows the couple two potential properties, but the third option creates a reaction she isnt expecting and suddenly the search is thrown up in the air

programme.desc: Leela worries about Ste when he doesnt come home, while Dillon jumps to conclusions, and Jez plans a memorial for Sienna. programme.desc: The singer visits the beautiful beaches of Mahe, one of the Seychelles most iconic islands. A trip across the palm-fringed island sees her creating a silk sarong before a trip to the market in the capital, Victoria

programme.sub-title: The Good, the Sad and the Drugly
programme.desc: Bart is on his best behaviour as he tries to win the affections of a girl at his school, while Lisa reports on what Springfield will look like in 50 years. With the voice of Anne Hathaway (Les Miserables)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The family go for a holiday at the seaside, where Homer is unwittingly tempted by a British femme fatale. With the guest voice of Olivia Colman

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Comic Book Guys origin story is revealed as he and his wife Kumiko debate having a baby

programme.title: Lego Masters Australia
programme.desc: As part of the 85th anniversary of DCs Batman, the teams have eight hours to create iconic vehicles for some of Batmans most notorious foes, to earn a spot in the semi-final. Each team is given an infamous Batman villain - from The Joker to Harley Quinn and Poison Ivy - and must construct a vehicle and a good-versus-evil Gotham City battle scene

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: A cabaret singer who once hid out in a convent is reunited with the nuns she befriended, who now need her help. She poses as a member of the order once more and joins the staff of a Catholic school threatened with closure, where she aims to make a success of the resident choir. Comedy sequel, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Kathy Najimy, Lauryn Hill, Maggie Smith and James Coburn

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: The return of the experiment to see whether science can help people fall in love. The first two couples marry at first sight. While an unexpected surprise transforms one grooms big day, will another grooms impromptu musical outburst be a major turn-off for his bride?

programme.title: MAFS UK: Its Official!
programme.sub-title: MAFS UK: Its Official! With Lucinda Light
programme.desc: Lucinda Light hosts Married at First Sight UKs official podcast, dissecting all the latest drama from the show, with celebrity guests, brides, grooms and the MAFS UK relationship experts. In this edition, she is joined by British drag performer and singer Danny Beard

programme.title: Virgin Island
programme.desc: Documentary following 12 adult virgins as they embark on a unique course in intimacy at a luxury Mediterranean retreat, to see if it can help them overcome the fears. In this first episode, the group arrive at the island retreat and learn more about the hands-on therapy, while the experts begin to get to grips with their issues. The group learn to cope with rejection and tune in to their innermost sexual desires

programme.title: Open House: The Great Sex Experiment
programme.desc: Nicolle and Ben arrive at the retreat keen to spice up their seven-year relationship by having sex with other people. However, when Nicolle reveals that shes a people pleaser who finds it hard to say no, Dr Lori warns the couple that Nicolle needs to vocalise her feelings. The pair invite resident couple Kiki and Sophia to spend some intimate time with them in the hot tub, and the fun continues in the bedroom. But is Nicolle as happy with the nights sexual climax as she seems? Meanwhile, thrill-seekers Katey and Dan pursue a live sex show experience

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: The return of the experiment to see whether science can help people fall in love. The first two couples marry at first sight. While an unexpected surprise transforms one grooms big day, will another grooms impromptu musical outburst be a major turn-off for his bride?

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Twenty six-year-old graphic designer Charlie says that some people describe her optimism as relentless. Shes matched with 25-year-old Australian osteopath Benj, who loves to talk about his feelings and is fond of a cry. Bus driver Tommy and electrician Luke both agree that they hate dating apps and hook-up culture. However, Luke then learns something about Tommy that leaves their date hanging by a thread. Stephen is divorced with two kids, hes 46, and he works as a toiletry products salesman. He gives his date, 42-year-old mum-of-one Rachel, a lesson in loo paper. Will she be happy to roll with it?

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil is unable to hide his excitement when hes invited to appear in a real-estate segment for the local news and the day gets even better after meeting his weatherman hero Rainer Shine (guest star Nathan Fillion). Meanwhile, Jay decides to infuse a little grit into Mannys video interview for his college application, and Lily decides to take matters into her own hands over her new house guest

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Leela worries about Ste when he doesnt come home, while Dillon jumps to conclusions, and Jez plans a memorial for Sienna. After a bumpy start, sparks begin to fly between two former lovers, theres a shocking discovery in a missing persons case, and Tom helps Tony to adapt to prison life. A resident gets backed into a corner, and a secret becomes too heavy to hold

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: There is a shocking discovery in a missing persons case, Tom helps Tony to adapt to prison life, and a resident gets backed into a corner

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Tony feels disheartened behind bars, but will the return of a familiar face help? Meanwhile, a secret becomes too heavy for one resident to hold

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits California, where his job is to help the owner of Lido Di Manhattan. Lisa Marie Hemmat, an ambitious business school graduate, has been running the restaurant for the past five years, but has failed to exert any control over the kitchen and the menu. The chef tries to teach her the basics of cooking and venue management, but trouble brews when her staff threaten to walk out on relaunch night

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: The return of the experiment to see whether science can help people fall in love. The first two couples marry at first sight. While an unexpected surprise transforms one grooms big day, will another grooms impromptu musical outburst be a major turn-off for his bride?

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and Marge remember the ups and downs of their marriage through a series of flashbacks, including the time they each began flirting with guests at a glamorous party - a situation that led to a food fight and an unexpected swim in the pool

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Despite being on the International Space Station, Howard gets caught in a strange argument between Bernadette and his mother via video link. Elsewhere, Raj feels lonely while his best friend is away and ends up interfering with Sheldons and Leonards dates. Comedy, starring Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny tells the girls she is unsure about her relationship with Leonard and is considering breaking up with him, but when Sheldon finds out, he tries his best to change her mind. Meanwhile, on the International Space Station, Howard is being bullied by the other astronauts. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire is suspicious when Grandpa Dunphy pays a surprise visit, while Cameron tries to find his inner drummer when he joins Dylans band. Meanwhile, Jay and Gloria regret taking Manny to see a horror film. Comedy, guest starring Fred Willard

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay discovers Gloria has planned a romantic getaway to Hawaii for his birthday, but his excitement fades when he realises the rest of the clan will be joining them. Starring Ed ONeill and Sofia Vergara

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Bernadette and Howard host a dinner party, but as it falls on Sheldons Thai food night, he opts to bring his own dinner. As punishment for his lack of manners, the gang decides he should organise Wolowitzs cluttered wardrobe, but he discovers an unopened letter from Howards father, who hasnt made contact in years

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys compete for a tenured professor position at the university, leading them to try to win over the committee in charge of appointing a new staff member, and arguing about who deserves the spot the most. However, the panel includes Mrs Davis from Human Resources, whom Sheldon has crossed paths with before. Guest starring Regina King

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy tries to help Sheldon get over his desire for closure when one of his favourite TV shows is cancelled on a cliffhanger ending. Raj discovers his new girlfriend Lucy has a blog in which she has written about him, and is upset when he learns she believes he has feminine qualities, causing him to worry about their relationship

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon discover their favourite childhood TV science show host Professor Proton can be booked for private parties and decide to hire him to entertain them. Meanwhile, Raja asks Howard and Bernard to look after his dog for the weekend, but the couple panic when the canine goes missing. Guest starring Bob Newark

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: When one of the precincts in the area must be closed, an evaluation process takes place. The squad is confident about its assessment - until it turns out the auditor is Santiagos ex-boyfriend Teddy

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: A burglary on the set of a TV detective show distracts Peralta and Diaz from the precincts on-going evaluation. As the rest of the squad concentrate on the task in hand and a new auditor takes over, Peralta finds himself charmed by the glamour of showbusiness

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: In the Name of the Grandfather
programme.desc: After ducking out of a bonding session with Grampa, a guilt-ridden Homer vows to make it up to his father by granting him a wish. The old man decides to visit Ireland and drop in on his favourite pub from his army days. Upon arrival, the pair discover the bar is a shadow of its former self, and agree to buy the business and turn its fortunes around

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.desc: Bart sees into his future with the help of a mysterious casino owner and learns he will become a struggling musician with Ralph Wiggum as a room-mate, while Lisa seems destined to hold the office of US president

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.desc: An international DJ who has learned some new things about her sexuality after a recent holiday to Ibiza now has to get to grips with Londons same-sex dating scene - which is not easy when her first date is someone she previously blanked on a dating app. A man with deteriorating vision and a desire to start a family is paired with a trombone player, while other candidates include a full-time carer and a medical student looking to date outside her profession

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: While one bride makes a showstopping entrance, another suffers a major wedding day wobble. Meanwhile, the first set of newlyweds jet off on their honeymoons

programme.title: Kind Hearts and Coronets
programme.desc: The penniless grandson of a duke plots to eliminate the eight relatives standing between him and a vast inheritance. He shoots, drowns, poisons and explodes his way through his family tree, but his final triumph is ruined when his lady loves husband kills himself. Ealing black comedy, starring Alec Guinness as all eight potential victims, with Dennis Price, Valerie Hobson and Joan Greenwood

programme.title: Think Like a Dog
programme.desc: A 12-year-old tech prodigys science experiment goes awry and he forges a telepathic connection with his dog. The duo join forces and use their unique perspectives on life to overcome complications of family and school. Family comedy drama, starring Josh Duhamel, Megan Fox and Gabriel Bateman

programme.title: Dunston Checks In
programme.desc: A gentleman jewel thiefs pet orang-utan runs amok in a swanky hotel, causing endless problems for the put-upon manager who has enough on his plate trying to ensure the establishment successfully attains a six-star rating. Family comedy, starring Jason Alexander, Rupert Everett, Faye Dunaway, Eric Lloyd and Paul Reubens

programme.title: Secret Headquarters
programme.desc: Fourteen-year-old Charlie Kincaid yearns for a deeper connection to his father Jack, who frequently disappears at short notice for work. When an IT conference interrupts Charlies birthday, the teenager invites friends to a party at his fathers house, and they stumble upon a subterranean, gizmo-laden lair. Comedy adventure, starring Owen Wilson, Walker Scobell and Michael Pena

programme.title: Fishermans Friends
programme.desc: A music executive heads out to a Cornish fishing village on a mission to recruit a group of 10 local fishermen into recording an album of sea shanties. He struggles to win over the unlikely boy band and their families, but begins to gain a new appreciation for their traditional values. Comedy, starring James Purefoy, Daniel Mays and Tuppence Middleton

programme.title: Wild Card
programme.desc: Las Vegas bodyguard Nick Wild finds himself dealing with more than just his gambling problem after he takes revenge on the criminal who attacked his friend, little realising that the thug in question is the son of a mob boss. Action thriller, starring Jason Statham, Michael Angarano and Milo Ventimiglia

programme.title: Glass
programme.desc: An invulnerable vigilante battles a murderer with multiple personalities - only for both to be apprehended and transferred to a psychiatric hospital. They find themselves under the care of a sinister doctor who has plans concerning their unique abilities, but also sharing the facility with a third patient, a criminal mastermind the crime fighter had encountered before, and who is soon manipulating everyone to his own ends. M Night Shyamalans fantasy thriller, crossing over the characters from his earlier films Unbreakable and Split. Starring James McAvoy, Bruce Willis and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Benjamin
programme.desc: An up-and-coming filmmaker tries to balance a romance with a visiting French music student and the release of his second movie. A lot of time has elapsed since his acclaimed debut and Benjamin is concerned that his follow-up will be a disaster. Writer/director Simon Amstells comedy drama, starring Colin Morgan, Jack Rowan and Anna Chancellor, with cameos from Mark Kermode and Simon Mayo

programme.title: The Winslow Boy
programme.desc: The father of a Navy cadet accused of theft goes to great lengths to restore his sons tarnished reputation. Historical courtroom drama based on a play by Terence Rattigan, starring Robert Donat, Margaret Leighton, Cedric Hardwicke and Basil Radford.

programme.title: The 300 Spartans
programme.desc: The ruler of the Persian empire vows to expand his realm by conquering Greece. The king of Sparta steps forward to defend his homeland and the other kingdoms of Greece, but when he is betrayed by a political council, he finds himself without an army and must fend off the vast invading army with a mere 300 warriors. Historical drama, starring Richard Egan, Ralph Richardson and Diane Baker

programme.title: The Devil at 4 OClock
programme.desc: A priest is sent to a South Seas island to replace a drunken missionary, who has been relieved of his duties. Sharing his flight are three convicts being sent to work at a childrens leper hospital. The five men must work together to protect the young patients when a volcano erupts, leaving them stranded with no easy way out. Adventure, starring Spencer Tracy, Frank Sinatra and Kerwin Mathews

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: The story of the Battle of Midway, a clash between the American fleet and the Imperial Japanese Navy, which marked a pivotal turning point in the Pacific Theatre during the Second World War. When US intelligence intercepts messages detailing a Japanese attack on an unnamed location, it becomes a race against time to both figure out where will be hit next and how to prepare for an impending battle. Roland Emmerichs drama, starring Ed Skrein, Patrick Wilson, Woody Harrelson and Luke Evans

programme.title: Infinite
programme.desc: A man who finds himself troubled by memories that are not his and developing skills he never learned is recruited by a mysterious organisation. The members of this group have learned to access the experiences of their past lives, but one has gone rogue, and must be stopped in his efforts to end the cycle of reincarnation by destroying all human life. Sci-fi thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: Team America: World Police
programme.desc: An American counter-terrorism unit travels around the world on the lookout for threats to global peace, causing much destruction to major world cities in the process. The biggest current menace is North Korean leader Kim Jong-il and an organisation much closer to home - the Film Actors Guild. Satirical puppet comedy, voiced by South Park creators Trey Parker and Matt Stone

programme.title: Antwone Fisher
programme.desc: A troubled Navy recruit is prone to violent outbursts and is ordered to see a psychiatrist, who gradually helps the mentally scarred sailor to come to terms with his past and abusive childhood. Fact-based drama, directed by and starring Denzel Washington. With Derek Luke, Joy Bryant and Salli Richardson

programme.title: Sands of Iwo Jima
programme.desc: A tough, embittered US marine sergeant sets out to mould a group of raw recruits into men fit for action against the Japanese in the Pacific during the Second World War. Adventure, starring John Wayne, John Agar, Adele Mara and Forrest Tucker

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Dour DI Jack Frost suspects a man he arrested years before for a series of bizarre assaults on children could have returned to the area and recommenced his unsavoury activities. He tracks down the culprit, who swears he has turned over a new leaf, and decides not to charge him - a decision that shocks fellow sleuth DS Maud, whose misgivings are later justified in tragic fashion. Starring David Jason, Peter Gunn, Susannah Doyle, Bruce Alexander, John Lyons and Gwyneth Powell

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective begins to suspect something is amiss when he visits one of his favoured haunts in London for dinner and discovers a fellow regular has dramatically changed his diet. Down in Brighton, elderly Anthony Gascoigne lies dying while his estranged twin brother Henry falls to his death - but nobody is sure whether the man was deliberately pushed. Bizarrely, the key to the riddle seems to lie in a blackberry pie. David Suchet stars in the title role, with Philip Jackson, Hugh Fraser and Pauline Moran

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Morses investigation into a number of untimely death notices in the Oxford Mail, each with a cryptic message, takes him to a series of funerals before forcing him to confront his own mortality. Thursday is facing more than one confrontation of his own as his past closes in on him, while he resorts to desperate measures to protect those he loves most. Final episode of the Inspector Morse prequel, starring Shaun Evans and Roger Allam

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: Climb the Greasy Pole - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. A seat becomes vacant on the local council when Sam Popham is taken ill, so Pop stands in the election, and Mariette returns from holiday with Charley. David Jason stars

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: Climb the Greasy Pole - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Pop and Ma become the target of dirty tricks and smear tactics during the election campaign, and Charley is placed in a compromising position by Abigails teacher

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: Newlyweds Mike and Ellie decide to build their dream home at a beauty spot called Gypsys Acre, ignoring the warnings of elusive romany Mrs Lee about an ancient curse supposedly cast upon the land. The couple settle into their new life, but the mysterious woman makes her presence felt, subjecting them to a campaign of hatred in an attempt to force them out. Tragedy soon strikes, but as luck would have it Miss Marple is staying nearby with her recently widowed old friend Mrs Phillpot. However, if the spinster sleuth is to solve the puzzle, she must put her own life in grave danger. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, with Wendy Craig, Glynis Barber, Hugh Dennis, Tamzin Outhwaite, Tom Hughes, Joanna Vanderham, Aneurin Barnard, William Hope and Janet Henfrey

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A woman is murdered in a hedgerow but her son survives the attack, only to fall beneath the ice of a frozen pond as he makes his escape. DCI Vera Stanhope wades in and drags him out, and against all the odds he pulls through. As the investigation into the mothers killing unfolds, Vera finds a kindred spirit in the boy and comes to realise the key to solving the case lies deep in his memory. Detective drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, with Kerry Fox and Kieran OBrien

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The annual Scarecrow Festival takes a grisly turn as bodies begin appearing on poles displayed alongside their straw creations. Barnaby and Winters investigation reveals rivalries that run deep and shows people will do just about anything to win. Neil Dudgeon stars

programme.title: The Road to Coronation Street
programme.desc: Jane Horrocks and Jessie Wallace star in a one-off drama telling the story of how the long-running soap was born. Tony Warren joins producer Harry Elton and director Derek Bennett as they struggle to create the programme, faced with opposition from ITVs formidable bosses Sidney and Cecil Bernstein, while Margaret Morris begins the hunt for the shows cast. With David Dawson, Stephen Berkoff, Celia Imrie and Lynda Baron

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa is shocked and Martin suspicious by the unannounced return of her father. Ruth is helping Martin with his blood phobia when she discovers his predicament, and an unexpected caravan squatter thwarts Berts dreams of making a quick buck

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is drawn into Newcastles underworld to discover the identity of a murder victim found dead in the river, with no clue as to who he is apart from a distinctive drugs wrapper. She discovers the dead man had ties to some very dangerous people, many of whom may have wanted him dead, while a witnesss testimony links the case to a remote farm where a murder took place 13 years previously. The connection brings Kennys past back to haunt him, as he was responsible for seeing the perpetrator convicted

programme.title: I Fought the Law
programme.desc: At the retrial for Julies murder, the jury once again cannot reach a verdict. Ann finds herself at her lowest point as she faces the challenge of rebuilding her life while her daughters murderer is at large in the community. Horrifyingly, the killer begins to brag about how he got away with the perfect murder, knowing he is protected by the double jeopardy law. With the Crown having seemingly exhausted its powers, its down to Ann to find justice for Julie, launching a campaign to change the 800-year-old law

programme.title: I Fought the Law
programme.desc: Determined to overturn the double jeopardy law, Ann takes her fight for justice to the home secretary, while Julies son Kevin is now a teenager and starts to ask questions about how his mother really died. Anns crusade takes her to the House of Lords, where she speaks not as a politician but as a grieving mother, and wins them over unconditionally

programme.desc: Lexi, Debbie and Chas make plans to steal jewellery from Home Farm, while Lisa and Zak are upset to learn about Belles party. Billy tries to explain his actions to Daz.
